str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To receive, welcome, entertain (with hospitality), embrace. From apo and dechomai; to take fully, i.e. Welcome, approve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
Three thousand. From tris and chilioi; three times a thousand.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To place (put) to, add; I do again. From pros and tithemi; to place additionally, i.e. Lay beside, annex, repeat.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
